org.kiji.express.flow.framework
Class MapredInputFormatWrapper<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.express.flow.framework.MapredInputFormatWrapper<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat<Container<K>,Container<V>>
public class MapredInputFormatWrapper<K,V>
extends Object
implements org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat<Container<K>,Container<V>>

This file was adapted from: https://github.com/kevinweil/elephant-bird/blob/master/core/src/main/ java/com/twitter/elephantbird/mapred/input/DeprecatedInputFormatWrapper.java The wrapper enables an InputFormat written for new mapreduce interface to be used unmodified in contexts where a InputFormat with old mapred interface is required.

Current restrictions on InputFormat:
  • the record reader should reuse key and value objects
While this restriction is satisfied by most input formats, it could be removed with a configuration option.

Usage: 

    // set InputFormat class using a mapreduce InputFormat
    DeprecatedInputFormatWrapper.setInputFormat(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input.TextInputFormat.class, jobConf);
    jobConf.setOutputFormat(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TextOutputFormat.class);
    // ...

Author:
Raghu Angadi

Method Detail

setInputFormat

public static void setInputFormat(Class<?> realInputFormatClass,
                                  org.apache.hadoop.mapred.JobConf jobConf)
Sets jobs input format to MapredInputFormatWrapper and stores supplied real InputFormat class name in job configuration. This configuration is read on the remote tasks to instantiate actual InputFormat correctly.
